Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Climactic \Cli*mac"tic\, a. Of or pertaining to a climax; forming, or of the nature of, a climax, or ascending series.
A fourth kind of parallelism . . . is still sufficiently marked to be noticed by the side of those described by Lowth, viz., climactic parallelism (sometimes called ``ascending rhythm''). --S. R. Driver. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
climactic adj : consisting of or causing a climax; "a climactic development" [ant: {anticlimactic}]
